application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Works to tree protected by LBE ORDER NO 14 (2) 1969: 1x lime tree - crown reduction up to 2-3m.
decision_conditions: The crown reduction shall not exceed the previous pruning points, and the work shall be carried out as closely as possible to British Standard 3998 [2010] 'Tree Works'.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved tree.

Tree work should not be carried out during periods that are likely to interfere with or disturb breeding birds or mammals.Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) and Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2010).
This consent is valid for two years.Reason: In order that the nature of work pertaining to this consent remains appropriate.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet)
TPO TPO Name: LBE ORDER NO 14 (2) 1969Date of Order: 18/05/1970 00:00:00Species: LIME, Address: FLAT 2 22 BYCULLAH ROADSchedule ID: T0132
